summary: This is an email chain from September 2020 forwarding a message from a person claiming to be the grandson of a former housekeeper for Jeffrey Epstein. The grandson alleges his grandmother took memory cards, pictures, videos, and audio tapes from Epstein's Manhattan house when she was fired, and that they are being threatened by Epstein's lawyers to return the material. The message claims the material contains child pornography and that news organizations have verified it but are hesitant to publish.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The email discusses memory cards, pictures, videos, and audio tapes allegedly taken from his Manhattan house by a former housekeeper. The material is the subject of the correspondence.

persons.name: Maria F Suarez London
persons.context: Claims to be the grandson of a woman who worked as a housekeeper for Jeffrey Epstein in Manhattan between 2012 and 2017. States his grandmother took material from the house and they are being threatened by lawyers.

persons.name: Mark Remillard
persons.context: Reportedly gave the sender's contact information to the recipient and was hesitant to receive the alleged material because it contains child pornography.

persons.name: Mr Indieke
persons.context: Named, along with Mr Cann, as a lawyer threatening the sender to hand over the material taken from Epstein's house. The sender notes uncertainty about the spelling of the name.

persons.name: Mr Cann
persons.context: Named, along with Mr Indieke, as a lawyer threatening the sender to hand over the material taken from Epstein's house.

connections.description: Maria F Suarez London claims his grandmother was a housekeeper for Epstein and removed material from his home, alleging it contains evidence of criminal activity.
Described as a lawyer for Epstein, threatening to recover material allegedly taken from Epstein's property.
Described as a lawyer for Epstein, threatening to recover material allegedly taken from Epstein's property.
Mark Remillard reportedly gave Maria F Suarez London's contact information to the email recipient and was contacted about the alleged material.

events.title: Housekeeper's Employment
events.description: A woman, the grandmother of the email sender, allegedly worked as a housekeeper at Jeffrey Epstein's house in Manhattan.

events.title: Housekeeper Fired and Takes Material
events.description: On the day she was fired, the housekeeper allegedly took memory cards, pictures, video tapes, and audio tapes she had found hidden in Epstein's Manhattan house.

events.title: Initial Email Sent
events.description: Maria F Suarez London sends an email alleging possession of material from Epstein's house and threats from lawyers.

events.title: Email Forwarded
events.description: The email from Maria F Suarez London is forwarded within an organization, with a note questioning its legitimacy.

keyFacts: An individual claims his grandmother, a former housekeeper for Jeffrey Epstein in Manhattan (2012-2017), took memory cards, pictures, videos, and audio tapes from the house when she was fired.
The claimant alleges the material contains child pornography.
The claimant states they are being threatened by lawyers identified as Mr. Indieke and Mr. Cann (allegedly for Epstein) to hand over the material.
The claimant attempted to give the material to ABC News correspondent Mark Remillard, who was hesitant to receive it due to its alleged content.
FOX News allegedly verified the authenticity of the material through a correspondent in Colombia but would only release some of it 'for political reasons' according to the claimant.
